intro: Leptopus nanus, commonly known as the dwarf sea holly, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, small, blue or violet flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other members of the carrot family. Leptopus nanus thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found growing in coastal dunes or near the shoreline.
